metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9119 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
The i_zval_ptr_dtor function in Zend/zend_variables.h in PHP 7.1.5 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact by triggering crafted operations on array data structures.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-9119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php8.0 - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.2
libphp8.0-embed - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.2
php8.0 - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.2
php8.0-bcmath - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.2

notes.Note: leosilva> unfixed upstream as of 2020-06-23 rodrigo-zaiden> php7.0 retriage on 2022-02-01 found that upstream fixed it on 2020-09-03, information is now updated to reflect this.

criterions.comment: php8.0 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.8-1ubuntu0.2').
